CONJUGATES: census (n. singular) | censuses (n. plural) | census (v. base) | censuses (v. 3rd person singular present) | censusing (v. present participle) | censused (v. past simple, past participle)
ETYMOLOGY: From Latin census ('a registration of citizens and their property'), from censere ('to assess, estimate')
SINCE: Late 15th century (as noun); mid 19th century (as verb)

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: "n." is an abbreviation for "noun", a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An official count or survey, especially of a population, typically recording various details of individuals.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 官方的统计或调查，尤指人口普查，通常记录个人的各种详细信息。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The government conducts a national census every ten years to gather demographic data.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 政府每十年进行一次全国人口普查以收集人口统计数据。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: "v.tr." is an abbreviation for "transitive verb", a verb that requires one or more objects.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To take a census of (a population or area); to officially count and record details about.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 对（人口或区域）进行普查；官方统计并记录其详细信息。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: They were tasked with censusing the remote villages to understand the living conditions.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他们的任务是对偏远村庄进行普查，以了解其生活状况。

REGISTER: Formal or neutral, commonly used in governmental, academic, and statistical contexts.
